prompt: Is it recommended to use rm -rf command to remove a workspace? ->
completion: No, it is recommended to use p4w remove command instead

prompt: What flag should you use to bypass sanity check and skips file verification when using p4w sync_all? ->
completion: -bsc

prompt: What is the function of p4w sync_local? ->
completion: to sync all files under the import directory

prompt: What information does the "p4 describe <CL>" command provide? ->
completion: it provides the description of a changelist

prompt: What is the function of p4 edit? ->
completion: to edit files

prompt: Can you give an example of using the p4 add command? ->
completion: p4 add myfile.txt

prompt: How does the p4 change command work? ->
completion: It assigns a changelist number to your edited files in workspace

prompt: What is the syntax for submitting a changelist using the p4 command? ->
completion: p4 submit -c <CL>

prompt: What is the function of the p4 login -a command? ->
completion: To validly login to the lsf machine when facing a p4 password error on a new workspace

prompt: What is the function of the "p4 changes -u <user> -s submitted -m 10" command? ->
completion: To retrieve and display the submission history of a specific user for the last 10 submissions.

prompt: What does the p4 diff ... command do? ->
completion: it diffs all opened files in the workspace

prompt: What does the p4 diff command compare? ->
completion: It compares the current unsubmitted changes to the specified file

prompt: When would you use the "p4 diff <file>" command? ->
completion: when you want to diff a single file

prompt: What is the function of p4 revert -w command? ->
completion: To revert all changes and delete all added files

prompt: What is the function of the p4 sync -n command? ->
completion: to determine if a file requires syncing

prompt: How can you check if a file needs to be resolved using a Perforce command? ->
completion: By using the command "p4 resolve -n <file>"

prompt: What is the purpose of using the command "p4 resolve ..."? ->
completion: to resolve all the files with the current CL

prompt: How does the p4w resolve command work? ->
completion: It resolves all the files with the current CL.

prompt: When would you use the command "p4 opened ..."? ->
completion: when you want to view all the opened files

prompt: What function does the p4 opened command serve? ->
completion: to check if a file is opened

prompt: What is the function of the command "p4 filelog" in Perforce? ->
completion: To display the revision history of a file.

prompt: What does the "p4 changes -u <user> -s shelved" command show? ->
completion: Shelved changes made by a specific user

prompt: What is the function of p4 reopen command? ->
completion: To reopen files to a different changelist

prompt: What is the purpose of using p4 shelve -c <CL>? ->
completion: to shelve the change of a CL

prompt: When would you use the p4 unshelve -s <CL> command? ->
completion: when you want to unshelve the change of a specific CL

prompt: What command would you use to delete a shelved changelist? ->
completion: p4 shelve -c <CL> -d

prompt: What is the function of the p4 shelve command? ->
completion: To shelve a change

prompt: What is the command to sync local changes in Perforce? ->
completion: p4w sync_local

prompt: What does the "-s" flag specify in the given command? ->
completion: the desired status of the changelists to be listed

prompt: What are the options used with the "p4" command to delete a Changelist CL? ->
completion: -p atlvp4p01.amd.com:1677 -u <USERNAME> -c <workspace name from list> -H ltipc1119 shelve -d -c <CL>

prompt: Why is it important to sync to the CL mentioned by "lastgood" before running dv_check_submit? ->
completion: To ensure that the code is in a stable state

prompt: What is the purpose of running "dv_check_submit -c <CL>"? ->
completion: To ensure that the CL is in a good state before submitting it

prompt: When would you use the command "cat $STEM/configuration_id"? ->
completion: When you want to view the current synced changelist.

prompt: Which command should you use to open the verdi window for a particular config? ->
completion: load_verdi <config_name>

prompt: What is the purpose of the "go" command? ->
completion: to go to $STEM

prompt: Which command should you use to turn your branch directory into Microsoft Visual Studio? ->
completion: code .

prompt: What command should you use to view all the codelines? ->
completion: p4_mkwa -print

prompt: When would you use the p4_mkwa command? ->
completion: when you want to list all the branches

prompt: What does the -changelist flag do in the p4_mkwa command? ->
completion: it specifies the changelist to which the workspace should be synced

prompt: Which logs the output of tile build to a file named "tilebuild.log"? ->
completion: the command "dj -m 8 -v -e 'connectivity::bia_ifrit_tile_view_flow.build' -l tilebuild.log"

prompt: What is the command to run a build only on the local machine? ->
completion: hbo

prompt: What command can be used to display the memory and queue used for running test? ->
completion: echo $DJ_GCF_OPTS

prompt: What should be done to change the memory and queue values in the echo output? ->
completion: replace them with higher mem and different queue

prompt: What does the `bdji -resume ...` command do? ->
completion: It allows you to restart the build from the specific failed action

prompt: What should be included in the "-D" flag in the "bdji" command? ->
completion: All necessary defines for the DV test

prompt: What does the "-Jlsf" option do? ->
completion: It specifies the test suite and the name of the test case

prompt: What does the "-a build -a build_sim" option do? ->
completion: It specifies to perform both build and simulation

prompt: What is the difference when using bdji in elkrange? ->
completion: In elkrange, use -j tool_sim_assemble instead of -j sim_build

prompt: What is the purpose of the "-DRUN" flag in the "bdji" command? ->
completion: To run the test after VCS build

prompt: What is the purpose of the -D option in the "bdji" command? ->
completion: To specify necessary defines

prompt: How do you specify a specific test in the "bdji" command? ->
completion: By using the "-e" option followed by the test name within single quotes

prompt: How can you specify additional defines in the "bdji" command? ->
completion: By using the "-D" option followed by the necessary defines

prompt: What does the "-Jlsf rt" option do? ->
completion: It specifies the test suite and test name

prompt: What is the purpose of the "-e" flag in the "bdji" command? ->
completion: To specify the test suite and filter criteria for the regression.

prompt: What is the purpose of using the "-a" flag in the "bdji" command? ->
completion: to start the build process

prompt: What is the function of the bdji command? ->
completion: to run multiple testcases
